{{Infobox figure skater |name= Max Aaron |image= |caption= |fullname= |altname= |country= [[United States of America|United States]] |formercountry= |birth_date= {{birth date and age|1992|2|25}} |birth_place= [[Scottsdale, Arizona]] |hometown= Scottsdale, Arizona |residence= [[Colorado Springs, Colorado]] |height= {{height|m=1.73}} |coach= [[Tom Zakrajsek]]
Becky Calvin |formercoach= Julie Patterson
[[Doug Ladret]] |choreographer= [[Tom Dickson]]
[[Catarina Lindgren]] |formerchoreographer= |skating club= [[Broadmoor SC]] |began skating= 1996 |retired= |combined total= 193.92 |combined date= [[2011 World Junior Figure Skating Championships|2011 Junior Worlds]] |SP score= 66.96 |SP date= 2011 Junior Worlds |FS score= 126.96 |FS date= 2011 Junior Worlds }} '''Max Aaron''' (born February 25, 1992) is an [[United States|American]] [[figure skater]]. He is the 2011 [[2011 United States Figure Skating Championships|U.S. national junior champion]]. == Career == Aaron began skating as a hockey player at age four and later switched to [[figure skating]] at age nine. During the 2009-10 season, he won the bronze medal at the [[2010 United States Figure Skating Championships|U.S. national junior championships]]. The next season, he won the [[2011 United States Figure Skating Championships|national junior title]] and was assigned to the [[2011 World Junior Figure Skating Championships|2011 World Junior Championships]] where he placed 5th. == Personal life == Aaron was born in [[Scottsdale, Arizona]]. He graduated from [[Cheyenne Mountain High School]] in 2010. His sister Madeline is also a figure skater and won the gold medal in novice pairs at the 2011 U.S. Championships. == Programs == {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- ! Season !
